intro: Gouania madagascariensis, commonly known as the Madagascar gouania, is a member of the Malvaceae family. It is a shrub native to Madagascar, characterized by its woody stems and palmate leaves. The plant produces small, white flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, followed by capsule fruits containing numerous seeds. It thrives in moist, shaded environments, often found in tropical rainforests. Its botanical features make it an important component of Madagascar's unique flora.
